ggeasy 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • `ggplot2` Shortcuts

Easily rotate x axis labels

easy_rotate_labels.Rd

A shortcut to

easy_rotate_labels(which = c("both", "x", "y"), angle = 90,
  side = c("left", "middle", "right"), teach = FALSE)

easy_rotate_x_labels(angle = 90, side = c("left", "middle", "right"),
  teach = FALSE)

easy_rotate_y_labels(angle = 90, side = c("left", "middle", "right"),
  teach = FALSE)

Arguments

which

which axis or axes to rotate, by default "both"
angle

angle through which the text should be rotated. Can also be one of "startattop" or "startatbottom" to define where the text should start.
side

horizontal justification of the text before rotation
teach

print longer equivalent ggplot2 expression?

Value

a theme object which can be used in ggplot2 calls.

Details

theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle, hjust))

Examples

library(ggplot2)
ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, hp)) +
  geom_point() +
  easy_rotate_labels()

Contents
